Source code for accounts.forms

from django.forms import ModelForm
from .models import Book, UserProfile, Submit, AddCourse, CreateCourse, Assignment, Solution, Grade
from django import forms
from django.contrib.auth.models import User


[docs]class BookForm(ModelForm):
	"""This is a class representation of form for assignment creation

   

    """

[docs]	class Meta:
		model = Book
		help_texts = {
			'extensions': 'Enter comma separated extensions. Example: pdf, docx, txt',
		}
		fields = ['num', 'course', 'Assignment', 'extensions']

	"""

		model = Submit
		fields = ['num', 'course', 'Submission']

		model = Grade

	"""This is a class representation of form for creating course
	"""

		model = AddCourse
		fields = ['code']



[docs]class CreateCourseForm(ModelForm):
	"""This is a class representation of form for adding course
	"""

[docs]	class Meta:
		model = CreateCourse
		fields = ['course', 'code']



[docs]class UserForm(ModelForm):
	"""This is a class representation of form with user inputs

	#. clean()

	"""
	password = forms.CharField(widget=forms.PasswordInput)
	confirm_password = forms.CharField(widget=forms.PasswordInput())


[docs]	class Meta:
		model = User
		help_texts = {
			'username': 'Enter your College Roll No.',
		}
		fields = ['username', 'email', 'password']



[docs]	def clean(self):
		"""used to confirm password
		"""
		cleaned_data = super(UserForm, self).clean()
		password = cleaned_data.get("password")
		confirm_password = cleaned_data.get("confirm_password")

		if password != confirm_password:
			raise forms.ValidationError("password does not match")



[docs]class UserProfileForm(ModelForm):
	"""This is a class representation of form with additional information of user
	"""

[docs]	class Meta:
		model = UserProfile
		fields = ['full_name', 'year', 'identity']
